pageContext.claim: “I am very unhappy with a certain aircraft carrier that's way over budget. That was an Obama deal. So incompetent the way they give out contracts.”
pageContext.analysis: The initial $2.7 billion advance-construction contract for the Gerald Ford aircraft carrier, which was overbudget when finally commissioned in 2017, was awarded to Northrop Grumman in 2005, during the George W. Bush administration. The U.S. Navy then signed a $5.1 billion contract for design and construction in 2008, also during the Bush administration.
